(8) FUNDAMENTAL ASSUMPTIONS UNDERLYING NAEB BOARD OF DIRECTORS OPERATIOl
1* The Board is responsible for policy and program.
2. The President is responsible for the administration of the
Board*s policy and program, except as to responsibilities
specifically vested in other elected officers by the
Constitution and By-laws.
3. Under the President’s general direction and supervision
the Executive Director and other appointive officers shall
adhere to the policy and program laid down by the Board.
4. All the elected and appointed officers shall keep each
ofcher informed as to those of their actions affecting the
duties of any other officers.
(l) Except as noted in footnotes below the Board adopted
without change the Executive Committee's statement of:
(2) RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND THE NAEB
EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR
The relationship between the Board of Directors and the
Executive Director is that of a policy forming board and a
director of operations. The duties and responsibilities of
each may be further defined as follows:
(1) The organization's budget (including the Kellogg budget)
shall be set by the Board. Money is to be expended only
with the prior authorization of the Board of Directors.
(2) Acting in accordance with Board of Directors general
policies and specific directives, the Executive Director
shall report to and consult currently with the President
as to his progress in carrying out the directives of the
Board. In the event interpretation is necessary, the
President shall provide insturctions to the Executive Director
as to his duties. The President and Board shall from
time to time review the work of the Executive Director. 1
(3) The Board adopted without content change the Executive
Committee's statement of:
(4) ABSIGNMENTS GIVEN TO EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR
1. Headquarters Functions
a. The Executive Director shall supervise the
organization's headquarters, including the operations
of the tape network.
b. He shall prepare a headquarters operational manual.
c. He shall organize the files of the organization,
compile and maintain a membership facilities list, and col¬
lect membership data.
